item.title: Happiness is not a scroll away
item.description: When you open your browser, you usually have a legitimate interest. What’s the weather like tomorrow? How long is the flight? How do you write “definitively”? All valid questions, and the Internet provides. But then, you jump to another type of content. This second phase starts with a dangerous question that defines what you’re about to do: “What new things do you have for me?”. Like in a slot machine, you insert your coin and pull the lever of the Internet to see what you get.

item.title: All Different Variants
item.description: In the earlier posts I’ve described some of the basic ideas behind CSPs: how the problems are represented using variables and constraints, how the solver searches for a solution by building up the search tree, how heuristics guide the search, and how constraint propagation helps eliminate parts of the search space that will not contain solutions. In this post I will look at how modeling the problem itself can have a significant influence on how quickly the solver is able to find a solution.
item.author: (Andrei)

item.title: The Solution Space
item.description: In late 2023, I still don’t think we’ve seen the peak of AI-mania. It will likely come at some point soon when more data reveals realized ROI from enterprise SaaS companies integrating the first wave of generative-AI experiences into their existing products. I’m not a techno-pessimist by any means, but I like to view technology through the lens of utility, and I just haven’t seen all that much yet from large-language models.
item.author: (Seth Kimmel)
